name: Overworld (1-50)

quests.name: I Summon Thee!
quests.description: Summoners are powerful creatures that can be found randomly in the Overworld. They usually spawn where a storm is brewing...

quests.name: Next Steps
quests.description: Defeat the Wither to access these daily quests.

quests.name: Setting Up Camp
quests.description: in [Harmony], invasions occur every few days in the form of blood moons. Trap Expansion is a mod that brings various traps to help you defend against invasions in your home!

quests.name: Despair
quests.description: Age of Exile brings its own Overworld boss known as the Corrupted Golem. To learn how to craft the golem, view the Age of Exile guide.

quests.name: Not Chocolate
quests.description: TERRA fish... I wonder where you'll find this one.

quests.name: Stations, Everyone!
quests.description: Gear obtained across dimensions tends to pile up i your inventory. In fact, what even are runes and gems? Stations are available for you to craft to give you options on ehancing your gear or salvaging them. The modify station allows you to apply "currencies", valuable orbs, to your gear to reroll or completely change its stats. The salvage station breaks down gear into crafting components such as essence, and the repair station repairs your gear. Lastly, the socket station lets you insert runes and gems into your socket-able gear to enhance its stats!

quests.name: Epilogue
quests.description: Defeat the Ender Dragon to access this weekly quest.

quests.name: Tastes Like One Though
quests.description: Many of the fish in Go Fish are cookable into unique dishes. Check out the REI for more information! Just search "@gofish".

quests.name: Boss Me Around! (Weekly)
quests.description: Defeat all the bosses for an awesome reward!

quests.name: Enchanter's Craft
quests.description:
With Grind Enchantments, you can put an enchanted item and a book into the grindstone, and you will get the enchantments onto the book (and your unenchanted item back). If you put an enchanted book into the top slot and an empty (or also already enchanted) book into the bottom slot of the grindstone, the enchantment at the top of the first book will be put onto the other book.
This is useful if you have a book that has enchantments for different types of items (for example, a book with Efficiency and Protection), so you can seperate them.

quests.name: Waystones
quests.description: Waystones are a fantastic way to quickly get from point A to point B. They are naturally occurring in villages. They are also craftable! Additionally, you can craft warp scrolls and pocket wormholes to teleport you from any location to a waystone! This cannot be done interdimensionally. Scrolls are single-time use, and wormholes are multiuse with a cooldown!

quests.name: Thunder Attribute (Daily)
quests.description: Kill thunder mobs. Thunder mobs can be found more commonly in mountainous biomes.

quests.name: Age of Exile
quests.description: Age of Exile offers integration with Patchouli to bring you a beginner's manual. The recipe for the book is a bone on a book. You can also buy the book if you ever lose it from 'The Exchange' chapter.

quests.name: Double Double
quests.description: Age of Exile is highly compatible with Minecraft mods! Enchantments and potions will work as intended!

quests.name: Stay Away!
quests.description: In [Harmony], there are many ranged weapons. Even melee gets a semi-ranged weapon! The spear is a weapon added by Campanion that has been configured to be fully compatible with Age of Exile. Additionally, hammers from Better End have been added and are slower, but more powerful weapons!

quests.name: Just Vanilla
quests.description: Like most Minecraft scendarios, one of the first things you do is craft a crafting table. Upon completing this quest, you will be able to choose from 4 starter weapons!

quests.name: Nature Attribute (Daily)
quests.description: Kill nature mobs. Nature mobs can be found more commonly in forest and jungle biomes.

quests.name: Arcana Attribute (Daily)
quests.description: Kill arcana mobs. You will find them throughout the world.

quests.name: Trading Post
quests.description: Craft a trading post to set up a shop for other players to use! Note: currently it's impossible to destroy the trading post without going into creative...

quests.name: Identification, Please!
quests.description: Sometimes, you'll encounter items that are unidentified and appear to have no stats. You can use an identify tome to reveal the stats on an item and make it usable.

quests.name: Improved Fishing
quests.description: Reinforcing your plain old wooden fishing rod with diamond is a sure-fire way to improve its sturdiness! You'll have better chances of finding rarer fish!

quests.name: Mistakes Were Made
quests.description: You can reset your stats and skills via potions in [Harmony]. So don't be afraid to test things out!

quests.name: A Hefty Price
quests.description: So you want to change your Ascendancy? You can... but at what cost?

quests.name: Frozen Crates
quests.description: Find these in cold biomes... Their loot is super COOL!

quests.name: Runewords
quests.description: Runewords are a powerful type of equipment that can be used help with the leveling process. In some cases, runewords can even be used in the end game. Find a piece of equipment with sockets, and insert the runes in a specific order. You can refer to the REI for what runewords are available and how to make them. You must insert the runes using a socketing station. Try making the Scholar runeword, which can only be applied to jewelry. Your jewelry must have at LEAST 2 sockets and be at least level 10. Look at the REI for more details!

quests.name: Storage Options
quests.description: You will quickly find yourself running out of space due to all the loot Age of Exile brings. Iron Chests are one of the more popular storage options available in [Harmony]! Additionally, Dank Storage is an extremely versatile storage option. They can be used as backpacks, and chests, and ignore the standard limit of 64 per stack!

quests.name: Go Fishing, NOW!
quests.description: Go Fish is a fantastic mod that brings about many different fishing rods, fishes, food, and crates! Think Terraria fishing, now in Minecraft. Isn't that awesome! Try collecting all the fish! There are quests for 90%+ of the fish, so complete the quests to complete your Pokede- I mean fishing journal!

quests.name: Loot Crates!
quests.description: While fishing, you may occasionally find crates! These crates are filled with fish, fishing rods, and occasionally, rare loot. Some crates are bound to certain biomes!

quests.name: Water Attribute (Daily)
quests.description: Kill water mobs. These can be found more commonly in water and cold biomes.

quests.name: Trash Collector
quests.description: Aw darn! You got seaweed... Hopefully this quest makes the first seaweed not so bad!

quests.name: XP Storage
quests.description: XP books are a cheap and efficient method for storing vanilla XP. You can even upgrade them to store more!

quests.name: The Phantom Menace
quests.description: Don't sleep for 3 in-game days, and phantoms will spawn! These undead manta rays will hunt you down at night!

quests.name: Warding Brush
quests.description: Although uncraftable, you will find across the world Ward blocks, which provide bonuses to nearby players when placed and supplied with redstone power!

quests.name: Snowed In
quests.description: Like many fish, some are biome specific. Can you guess where to get this one?

quests.name: That Ain't A Veggie
quests.description: You'll find these carrot fish all over the Overworld!

quests.name: Flame Attribute (Daily)
quests.description: Kill flame mobs. These can be found more commonly in hotter biomes.

quests.name: Age of Exile Mobs
quests.description: Age of Exile brings about changes to mobs and biomes. Biomes now have an associated typep with them which alter the type of mobs that spawn in that biome.

quests.name: Slimey Mobs (Daily)
quests.description: Even slimes have alternate attributes!

quests.name: Slippery Catch
quests.description: Wow! How're you gonna get an frozen fish?!

quests.name: Monster From The Depths
quests.description: Find a new type of mob deep in the ocean... To some, it may seem familiar. Once proposed as a plausible Minecraft mob and rejected due to a popularity vote, the lurker has come to seek revenge in Craft to Exile [Harmony]!

quests.name: Improved Fishing II
quests.description: Lures can improve your fishing luck! Just have them in your inventory.

quests.name: X Marks The Spot
quests.description: The Biome Locator is an item that allows you to find those pesky, rare biomes!

quests.name: Crafting More Gear
quests.description: Crafting armor is similar to crafting weapons but can be a little unintuitive. Crafting AoE gear will result in the expected type (e.g. cloth will result in cloth armor). Similarly, certain gear from vanilla and other mods can harness a certain type. For example: leather armor will always yield leather type (ranger), and iron will always yield plate type (warrior). View the Wiki for the list of craftables and their types, or just try it out!

quests.name: Skill Tree
quests.description: Skills are obtained by accessing the skill tree through the HUB. In [Harmony], the skill tree was highly configured and has many custom spells. Furthermore, a talent tree is available for you to customize your character! Press 'H' to access your stats and trees! Additionally, ores, leathers, and cloth are used in crafting various Age of Exile equipment. These are valuable resources that can be obtained from crafting dust which can be obtained from breaking down items in a salvage station.

quests.name: Lilypad or Fish?
quests.description: You'll probably have better luck in swamps...

quests.name: Repair Kits
quests.description: One of the worst feelings is dungeoneering and finding incredible loot, only to die to a creeper explosion because you didn't notice your armor breaking. Well, repair kits won't improve your perception, but they do offer a method of gear repair without needing to go back to a repair station. They are less efficient though...

quests.name: Crafting Gear
quests.description: You can craft all sorts of gear in [Harmony]! All gear is compatible and follows a loose progression system. You can craft gear from Age of Exile which tends to be stronger. Try crafting a vanilla wooden sword, and a sword from Age of Exile to see the difference!

description: Follow this quest chapter to learn the fundamentals of Craft to Exile!
